text: [Music]
jorinda and jorindel there was once an
old castle that stood in the middle of a
deep gloomy wood and then the castle
lived an old fairy this very could take
any shape she pleased she used to fly
about in the form of an owl or crept
about the country like a cat but at
night she always became an old woman
again get rid of these wrinkles and gray
hair but she couldn't she always
remained a grumpy old fairy ruling her
castle when any young man came within a
hundred paces of her castle he became
quite fixed and could not move a step
well she set him free Oh old fairy
please set me free I'm sorry I promise I
will never come here but when any maiden
came within that space
she was changed into a bird and the
fairy locked her into a cage there were
seven hundred of these cages hanging in
the castle and all with beautiful birds
in them there was a maiden whose name
was Geron de jorindel a shepherd boy who
was very fond of her and they were soon
to be married these woods are so
beautiful so peaceful yes my dear they
are but we must be careful that we don't
go too close to the castle are you
afraid of the old fairy
jorinda ran inside the woods teasing
jorindel they reached at the hilltop it
was a beautiful evening the last rays of
the Setting Sun shone bright through the
long stems of the trees upon the green
Underwood beneath and the Turtledove
sang from the tall birches isn't heaven
then what is jorinda sat down to catch a
breath
Jorund L sat by her side and both felt
sad Jorund oh I don't feel so good
me neither I feel as if I'm going to
lose you let's go home they look to see
which way they should go home they found
themselves at a loss to know what path
to take oh dear we are lost
the Sun was setting fast Jorund l on a
sudden looked behind him and saw that
unknowingly they sat down close under
the old walls of the castle
pale in fear Georgia was just seen this
is my Geron de Suisse
well again well
well when her song stops suddenly
Jorund l looked at her and watched her
change into a nightingale an owl with
fiery eyes flew around them and three
screamed
kirinda
no my darling I'll save you
Geor Adele could not move or speak what
has happened to me and my joy in de is
there no way out of this misery and now
the Sun went quite down the gloomy night
came the into a bush and a moment after
the old fairy came forth with staring
eyes there was another nightingale in my
village she mumbled something to herself
seized the nightingale and went away
with it in her hand
poor Jorund l saw the bird was gone
after some time from the fairy came back
and sang with a hoarse voice
the charm is around her and the spell
has bound her suddenly
Jorund elf found himself free then he
fell on his knees before the fairy and
prayed to her to give him back his dear
jorinda oh thank you dear old fairy now
also please free my jaronda from your
charm but I won't be able to live
without her please I beg of you but she
was unmoved by Joran Dells pleadings and
she just laughed at him and it went her
way he prayed he wept he sorrowed but
all in vain alas what do I do now how
can I go back home without my beloved
jorinda since he could not go back to
his own home he went to a strange
village and employed himself in keeping
sheep many a times he walked round and
round as near to the hated castle as he
dared go but all in vain he heard or saw
nothing of jorinda is there no hope for
me one night he dreamt that he found a
beautiful purple flower and that in the
middle of it lay a precious pearl and he
dreamt that he plucked the flower and
went with it in his hand into the castle
and that everything he
enchanted and that there he found his
jaronda again and that the old fairy
looked afraid of the pearl in the
morning when he awoke he was hopeful
this dream sure meant something maybe I
can find my jaronda after all so he
began to search over Hill for this
pretty flower and eight long days he
looked for it in vain
but on the ninth day he found the
beautiful purple flower and in the
middle of it was a large dew drop as big
as a precious pearl there you are you
will help me to find my jorinda then he
the flower and set out and
traveled day and night till he came
again to the castle
he walked nearer than a hundred paces to
it and yet he did not become fixed as
before but found that he could go quite
close up to the door Jorund l was very
glad indeed to see this this flower is
indeed magical dorinda here I come
then he touched the door and it sprang
open so that he went in through the
court and listened when he heard so many
birds singing jorinda must be here he
kept moving at last he came to the
chamber where the fairy satin with the
seven hundred birds singing in the seven
hundred cages oh why so many
nightingales when the fairy saw jorindel
she was very angry and screamed with
rage didn't I tell you to never come
back now you will pay with your life she
ran to attack him but she could not come
within two yards of him for the flower
he held in his hand was the safeguard he
looked around at the birds what
there were too many nightingales where
is my jar in de while he was thinking
what to do he saw the fairy had taken
down one of the cages and was making the
best of her way off through the door ah
there she is
he ran after her touched the cage with
the flour and Joey this stood before him
and threw her arms around
Jorund ELLs neck then he touched all the
other birds with the flour
[Music]
[Music]
and then jorindel sprinkled the dew drop
of flour at the old ferry to their
amazement turned into a nightingale
jorinda quickly picked the nightingale
and locked it in the cage it's over old
fairy come on my love Dorinda let's go
home and he took jorinda home where they
were married and lived happily together
and so did a good many other lads whose
maidens had been forced to sing in the
old fairy's cages
[Music]
